title: Halo gadgets updates
body: Includes prod and 512MiB K values, extended testing and test logging. some fmt and clippy updates, etc

title: Updated deps
chore: lock versions to the correct minor, and update
body:
1. Update minimum versions for in-workspace crates.
2. Use the tilde constraint to ensure that we don't update to the next minor version.

Otherwise, the next minor release (which will re-release the changes on master) will break anything depending on this release.

NOTE: we should also go ahead and _release_ those minor releases. This is kind of hard to test otherwise.

title: Releases/v11 update
fix: more sector logging
body:
Sometimes it's unclear from which sector an error originates from,
hence include the sector ID in the log messages.

title: feat: extend proofs API such that aggregation can use snarkpack versions
body:
feat: extend aggregation tests to ensure version incompatibility
feat: update dependencies

title: Bump rust-toolchain to 1.59.0
fix: SDR: update comment
body:
This commit fixes a comment that was outdated. Originally three atomics
were used. With commit [a43f3a9dbb9ef76b0053a9639e638a0478337f32] the
atomic that is tracking which node the consumer is currently working on
was moved into the `CacheReader`.

[a43f3a9dbb9ef76b0053a9639e638a0478337f32]: https://github.com/filecoin-project/rust-fil-proofs/commit/a43f3a9dbb9ef76b0053a9639e638a0478337f32#diff-c1a5ea514dd1555f26b0c1c63a7435ef2804e8759e44de747904ed4bcb47bf20L230-L231

Closes #1602.

title: chore: remove unused dependencies
body:
Remove unused dependencies. 
resolves #1598 .

title: chore: CI: run storage-proofs-update tests
body:
Run the `storage-proofs-update` crate tests as for any other crate.
Also simplify some test logic a bit.

title: chore: improve the macOS story on CI
body:
There is now a parameter files cache for Linux and one for macOS based
test runners. This should shorten the CI runtime for macOS.

title: refactor: remove duplicated tests
body:
Some tests were moved into separate test files, but the
original tests weren't deleted. This commit removes those
duplicated tests.

 - por_circuit tests already exist in
   storage-proofs-core/tests/por_circuit.rs.
 - por_compound tests already exist in
   storage-proofs-core/tests/por_compound.rs.
 - private_por_input_circuit tests already exist in
   storage-proofs-core/tests/por_circuit.rs.

title: chore: CI: split gpu tree building test runs
body:
Split the tree building CI runs into the ones from `filecoin-proofs`
`+ storage-proofs-update` and the rest for the ignored tests. This
should get the total runtime of those tests down to about 30mins.

title: chore: remove unused dependencies from storage-proofs-update
body:
`storage-proofs-update` includes a lot of dependencies it isn't actually
using, this commit removes those.

title: chore: ignore sector update compound tests
body:
The sector update compound tests take a long time to run, ignore them
by default, like other long running tests (e.g. the lifecycle ones).

The CI run for `test_arm_no_gpu` is reduced to about 30min (was 75min). `test_darwin` is down to about 45min (was 60min). The tree building "ignored" tests now obviously take longer to run, but still < 60min. The total run time on CI is down to 55min (was 75min).

title: tests: use non-failing fil_logger
body:
There are tests that initialized some logger. When initializing `fil_logger`,
it would panic. Use instead `fil_logger::maybe_init()` which doesn't fail in
case there is already a logger running.

title: fix: cli: make the default value of `clap` args work properly
body:
Remove `required(true)` if default value exists.

Resolves #1589

title: fix: SDR: make it possible to bind to cores if units > groups
body:
For multicore SDR it is important that the producer and conumers share the
same (L3) cache. Hence we bind specific cores to threads. Prior to this
change there was one multicore SDR job per group, even if the group could
accompany multiple of such jobs. If there were more jobs scheduled than
groups available, those additional jobs wouldn't use specific cores, but
whatever the operating system decided.

With this change, additional jobs are now put into the groups in case there
is enough space to accompany them.

Fixes #1556.

title: chore: most of CI now runs on the rust-toolchain defined version
body:
We use the `rust-toolchain` file in order to run things on a specific
version of Rust. Change the CI to use that version. Prior to this
commit it was using a nightly build, which was needed in the past,
but no longer.

The only exception is on ARM, where we still need nightly.

title: chore: CI: run no GPU tests in release mode
body:
Those tests run for a long time, release mode reduced the time. The
tests now run under 20mins, compared to over 1h prior to this commit.

title: chore: CI: don't always run test_seal_lifecycle_upgrade
body:
It probably was a debug left-over from the sector upgrade work. The
`test_seal_lifecycle_upgrade` test is included when running with
the default test arguments, so there's no need to mention it separately.
It was also run in the non-ignore case. There's no point of running
it twice.

title: Replaces #1578
body: This PR is on an editable branch and replaces #1578 (cc @Stebalien)

title: chore: CI: use parameter cache also for macOS
body:
In CircleCI you cannot restore a cache on macOS that was saved on Linux.
The workaround is to persist those files in a workspace. That workspace
can then be attached on macOS. So the workflow for macOS is:

  1. (Linux) Generate parameters and cache them
  2. (Linux) Restore cache and preserve in workspace
  3. (macOS) Attach workspace

title: chore: CI times out due to ipget issues
body:
Instead of using `paramfetch`, which is using `ipget`, get the file
via HTTP. This should solve problems with the CI job timing out.

title: perf(filecoin-proofs): increase parallelism in window-post
body: This improves the parallelism when generating merkle tree.

title: build: use rust-toolchain 1.56.0
body: This allows us to have dependencies that use Rust 2021 edition.

title: build: use byte-unit version which supports Rust 2018
body:
The current version of `byte-unit` uses Rust 2021 edition, which breaks our build.

Closes #1573

title: Improve PoSt benches
body:
feat: extend winning_post bench to allow fake seals
feat: add a window_post_fake bench for using fake seals
feat: bump default API version in both PoSt benches to current
docs: update documentation on bench usage

title: Reuse verify
fix wrong sector size on readme.md
fix: ensure that t_aux uses the specified path when clearing cache
Some test updates
body: I'm ok renaming the `big-tests` feature flag if there's a better suggestion.

title: Update SnapDeal production params
Fix empty sector update priority and add debugging
body: Resolves #1553

title: fix: correctly set cache path for empty sector update proofs
body:
**This PR is mostly intended to indicate where I think a bug exists**

I'm not entirely sure whether this is the right fix, but something around the cache path here seems to be wrong, causing most users on SnapNet to be unable to upgrade their sectors (see https://github.com/filecoin-project/lotus/issues/7968).

We may only want to be setting the path in some of the use cases for this method.

title: feat: update codeowners
feat: add releases dir with Cargo.lock files for each release
fix: make arguments mutually exclusive
body:
The command line argumens `--only-post` and `--only-sector-update` are mutually
exclusive. With this commit you'll get an error message if both are used at the
same time:

    error: The argument '--only-sector-update' cannot be used with one or more of the other specified arguments

    USAGE:
        paramcache --api-version <SEMANTIC VERSION> <--only-post|--only-sector-update>

    For more information try --help

title: feat: update paramcache to properly generate .meta files
body: doc: fix logging typo

title: Poseidon version of SnapDeals
body: Signed-off-by: Jakub Sztandera <kubuxu@protocol.ai>

title: fix: update heim dep to (current) master branch
reset consumer
body:
Reset consumer every time when finish one layer.

If consumer not reset, may cause parent cache loading problem.

1. `cur_parent_ptr`  may point to a released memory location, causing panic.
2. `cur_parent_ptr` may point to a wrong parent cache window, resulting wrong pc1 result.

title: feat: reduce verbose info logging
body: Resolves https://github.com/filecoin-project/rust-fil-proofs/issues/1523

title: feat: update bellperson to v0.18.0
body: This PR updates bellperson, neptune (for using the latest bellperson as well) and the rust-toolchain version.

title: Empty sector update tree r gpu
fix: benchy: print help if no command is given
body:
Prior to this change benchy will panic if there were no options given.
Now it prints the help.

I wanted to do this for years, finally I did.

title: feat: allow for window post proving on a partition basis
body:
This is based on #1497 and attempts to reduce the changes to a minimum needed. 

TODOs

- [ ] improve naming
- [ ] improve documentation
- [ ] review for more things that can be simplified

title: fix: remove FIL_PROOFS_CUDA_NVCC_ARGS environment variable
body:
The `FIL_PROOFS_CUDA_NVCC_ARGS` variable doesn't work as expected. The
problem is that its value would need to be forwarded to the dependencies
at compile-time. That currently isn't possible.

The solution is to set the `BELLMAN_CUDA_NVCC_ARGS` and
`NEPTUNE_CUDA_NVCC_ARGS` environment variable individually.

Set properly, the CI runs are 4mins faster :)

title: Add support for Empty Sector Update proofs (for SnapDeals)
chore: split gpu tree builder CI jobs
body:
A recent addition to CI are the gpu tree builder tests with the `ignore`
flag. Enabling those added a lot to the run time of a single job. Hence
split them into a separate job, so that the total run time of all the CI
is shorter again.

The "ignored" tests still take a long time to run, but at least the overall run time is a bit better.

title: fix: fall back to CPU if GPU is not available
body:
The current code expected that if the GPU-based tree building is enabled,
that there also is a working GPU available. When it is not, it panics.
This commit adds a fallback to CPU in case selecting a working GPU fails.

It can be verified by running

    FIL_PROOFS_USE_GPU_TREE_BUILDER=1 cargo test --test stacked_vanilla test_stacked_porep_prove_verify

if the machine has no working Nvidia or AMD GPU.

Fixes #1516.

title: fix: use GPU tree builder only for Poseidon hashes
body:
The GPU tree builder (Neptune) only supports Poseidon hashes. Switch
to the CPU tree builder if other hash algorithms are used (which isn't
the case in Filecoin at the moment).

Closes #1512.

title: ci: run gpu tree building tests on all tests
feat: update all dependencies for our v10.0.0 release
body: docs: update changelog for release

title: expose 'multicore-sdr' feature
body: You can't use the multicore-sdr feature through filecoin-proofs in current implemention.

title: refactor: remove pairing dependency for circuit
body:
Depends on 

- [x] https://github.com/filecoin-project/bellperson/pull/232
- [x] https://github.com/filecoin-project/neptune/pull/111

title: test(fil-proofs-tooling): warm up cache for window-post verify
fix: properly implement and document cuda feature
body:
It's possible to compile rust-fil-proofs to make it run on CUDA instead
of OpenCL. This change also includes the introduction of two new environment
variables. One to control, whether OpenCL or CUDA should be used. The other
to tweak `nvcc` options.

title: fix: upgrade to latest versions
body:
The latest versions of the gpu dependencies contain support for CUDA. Therefore
the `gpu` feature is split into `cuda` and `opencl`. By default only `opencl` is
enabled.

BREAKING CHANGE: The `gpu` feature is replaced by the `opencl` feature.

title: Revert "Improve multicore SDR"
body:
Reverts filecoin-project/rust-fil-proofs#1501

More testing is needed, to isolate a specific error.

title: Improve multicore SDR
body:
Based on #1477 this updates the parent selection logic in multicore sdr. 

It **does not** implement the bitmask update, as that is not thread safe, and only the thread that fills the buffer is allowed to set this value. This I missed in my earlier review.

title: feat: use upstream group, ff and pairing dependencies
body:
- [x] `filecoin-hashers`
- [x] `fr32`
- [x] `storage-proofs-core`
- [x] `storage-proofs-porep`
- [x] `storage-proofs-post`
- [x] `filecoin-proofs`
- [x] everything else

Note that this PR removes the `pairing` and `blst` features and drops support for `paired`'s BLS12-381 implementation.
